title: Police issue all clear after UMass Boston reports ‘public safety threat’
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: UMass Boston issued an all-clear after reporting a public safety threat around Residence Hall East Building.
Boston police found no confirmation of shots fired or individuals with firearms on campus during the incident.
The university canceled all evening classes and activities; police advised avoiding the area due to initial uncertainty.

title: ‘I would join a boycott’: Why readers oppose Market Basket’s firing of Artie T.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Market Basket's board fired CEO Arthur T. Demoulas, citing refusal to share company plans and comply with directives.
Over 86% of 2,500 Boston.com readers oppose Demoulas's firing, with 61% planning to boycott Market Basket.
The board's move follows prolonged tensions and a history of family conflicts over company control and management.

title: Boston City Council shows mixed support for rent control ballot question
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston City Council showed mixed support for a resolution backing a 2026 rent control ballot question.
Councilor Ed Flynn's objection directed the rent control resolution to a committee, stalling further discussion.
The proposed ballot measure would tie annual rent increases to cost of living, with a 5% cap and certain exemptions.

title: Haim praises Brick Street Bagels: ‘Bomb bagels’
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Haim praised Brick Street Bagels' products, calling them 'bomb bagels' during a recent WERS 88.9FM interview.
Brick Street Bagels plans to open a permanent location in South Boston this year, offering fresh bagels and more.
Founded in 2022, Brick Street Bagels gained popularity for its bagel drops and pop-ups in various Boston neighborhoods.

title: Thieves in Quincy are ordering pizzas then stealing the driver’s car, police say
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two pizza delivery drivers in Quincy had their cars stolen in similar schemes involving fake pizza orders.
On Aug. 31, a Five Star Pizza driver had his car stolen near Hancock and Berlin streets by masked individuals.
A Mama Bear's Kitchen driver was targeted on Sept. 7; his stolen car was later found at South Shore Plaza.

title: Man allegedly made bomb threats to Everett city councilor
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Scott Merchant, 36, of Salisbury, pleaded not guilty to charges after allegedly threatening an Everett city councilor with bombs.
FBI contacted Salisbury police after threats involving firearms and explosives were made via social media, leading to an arrest.
Merchant was charged and is set for a court hearing on Thursday to determine if bail can be granted.

title: Here’s why there are American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Boston Logan Airport
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Logan Airport honor victims of the 9/11 attacks.
Flags were raised without ceremony a month after 9/11 by airport and airline employees, according to Massport.
Due to terminal changes, four flags now fly over gates B32, C19, B11, and B27 at Logan Airport.

title: MassINC poll: Just over half of voters approve of Healey’s performance
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 56% of Massachusetts residents approve of Governor Maura Healey's performance, according to a MassINC poll.
Healey's support is strongest among Democrats, college-educated voters, and women over 50.
In contrast, 60% of Massachusetts residents disapprove of Donald Trump's performance in the state.

title: Where to find college student discounts in Greater Boston
author: Frances Klemm, Nia Harmon and Laura Emde
bullets: AMC Theatres offer special student pricing at Boston, Somerville, and Dorchester locations with a valid student ID.
ArtsEmerson provides student rush tickets for $10 and advance tickets for $20 to college and high school students.
Students can get free admission to ICA and the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum if their school is a member.

title: ‘It’s a cornerstone of who we are’: Read Rep. Lori Trahan’s letter to Market Basket board
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: U.S. Rep. Lori Trahan wrote an open letter protesting Arthur T. Demoulas's removal as CEO of Market Basket.
Demoulas's ousting follows a family feud and an investigation into allegations of orchestrating a work stoppage.
Trahan emphasized Market Basket's cultural significance, urging the board to consider employees and loyal customers.
